results.title: Angklung orchestra
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
An Angklung is a Javanese bamboo instrument which is rattled to produce a fixed note. Originally tuned to the pentatonic scale it was used in traditional music. However, today it is usually tuned to the diatonic scale and Western-style music is performed. In this film the Bandung Conservatorium Orchestra demonstrates the complexity of the instrument and plays a well-known waltz.

results.title: Painting people
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Six Australian artists - William Dobell, Russell Drysdale, Clifton Pugh, William Dargie, Jan Molvig and Andrew Sibley - discuss the problems of portraiture, including paintings of Tom Roberts and Arthur Streeton.

results.title: Anokhi
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
The story of John and Faith Singh and their work in maintaining the traditional hand printed clothing “industry” of the villages around Jaipur.

results.title: Rui
results.creator_credit: Social Education Materials Project and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
Rui is a young adolescent with an industrial inner suburb as a playground. His family does not get away during the school vacation so in order to cope with his environment Rui and his friend Con act out fantasies borrowed from television police dramas. While offering positive criticism on improving the area he also displays how he has been hardened by his environment. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Weekend
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Looks at the behaviour of a group of young teenagers over what is for them a typical weekend. The focus is on the peer group role in their lives and its significance in shaping expectations the boys and girls have of each other. (Includes footage of John Paul Young performing on stage.)

results.title: Five bells: sights and sounds of Sydney Harbour
results.creator_credit: Dean Semler, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Sydney Harbour, the most beautiful in the world, is celebrated in this lyrical documentary. Pre-dawn a memory of the Harbour’s convict past appears like a dream, but as the sun rises and the trawlers trek back with their cargo of prawns the Harbour comes to life in 1978. Australia’s multi-cultural society is epitomised in this film.

results.title: Leisure
results.creator_credit: Bruce Petty, Film Australia and Suzanne Baker
results.brief_description: A fast-paced, humorous film, animated by Bruce Petty. The film emphasises the use of leisure time as an important aspect of life in our society. Planning for recreation and leisure time should be undertaken both on a personal and a broad public level. (Awards: Winner of the 1976 American Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film)

results.title: Hospitals don't burn down
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A disturbingly realistic film about a fire in a high-rise hospital. It dramatically portrays the horror and awful consequences of such a tragedy. Demonstrates the results of good and bad training and the need for all personnel to learn basic drills and routines in case of fire. Cast includes Jeanne Drynan, Mark Edwards, Ray Marshall, Ralph Cotterill, Ken Goodlet.

results.title: The Passionate industry: 1920-1930
results.creator_credit: Joan Long, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “History of Australian Cinema Series”.
Traces the history of the Australian film industry in the decade 1920-1930. Includes material from fifty newsreels, sixteen feature films and still photographs drawn from our seventy collections. The program looks at the 1927 Royal Commission of Enquiry and Film Bill of 1927, as well as footage of the Regent, capitol and Old State Theatre of Melbourne.

results.title: Travellin' round
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Richard Mason, Tourism Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A girl and a boy in a Landrover, a motorcyclist and a continent. These are the most essential ingredients of a travel film with a difference, showing the beauties and splendours of Australia. Featuring Tom Burstall, Adam Plate, Ingrid Tantu, Lloyd Sutton, Susan Hannaford. Music and lyrics by Michael Carlos and Judy Henderson.
